briefInfo: Punishment for murder. The accused can face death penalty or life imprisonment along with a fine.
Attempt to murder. Covers cases where someone tries to murder another person but does not succeed.
Defines the offense of rape and specifies circumstances under which it is considered as such.
Sedition. Any act or speech that incites rebellion against the authority of the state.
Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property.
Punishment for rape. Includes imprisonment of not less than seven years, which may extend to life imprisonment.
Husband or relative of husband subjecting a woman to cruelty.
Dowry death. Involves the death of a woman caused by burns or bodily injury within 7 years of marriage due to dowry-related issues.
Assault or criminal force to a woman with intent to outrage her modesty.
Wrongful restraint. Preventing someone from proceeding in any direction they have the right to.
Defines theft as an act of dishonestly taking another personâ€™s movable property without consent.
Dishonestly receiving stolen property. Punishes anyone who knowingly receives or retains stolen goods.
Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means.
Criminal intimidation. Threatening someone with injury to their person, reputation, or property.
Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
Word, gesture, or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman.
Causing disappearance of evidence of an offense or giving false information to screen the offender.
Punishment for giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction.
Punishment for rioting. Includes any unlawful assembly involving violence.
